column3: Markdown lightweight markup language cheat sheet.

column1: *‖mdcomment/‖SI‖En‖<{!}-- This content will not appear in the rendered Markdown -->‖https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/writing-on-github/getting-started-with-writing-and-format

*‖mdfootnote/‖SI‖En‖Here is a simple footnote[{^}1].`n`nA footnote can also have multiple lines[{^}2].  `n`nYou can also use words, to fit your writing style more closely[{^}note].`n`n[{^}1]: My reference.`n[{^}2]: Every new line should be prefixed with 2 spaces.  `n  This allows you to have a footnote with multiple lines.`n[{^}note]:`n    Named footnotes will still render with numbers instead of the text but allow easier identification and linking.  `n    This footnote also has been made with a different syntax using 4 spaces for new lines.‖https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/writing-on-github/getting-started-with-writing-and-format

*‖mdheadings/‖MSI‖En‖{#} The largest heading¦{#}{#} The second largest heading¦{#}{#}{#} The third largest heading¦{#}{#}{#}{#} The fourth largest heading¦{#}{#}{#}{#}{#}{#} The smallest heading‖https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/writing-on-github/getting-started-with-writing-and-format

*‖mdlists/‖MSI‖En‖- George Washington`n- John Adams`n- Thomas Jefferson¦1. James Madison`n2. James Monroe`n3. John Quincy Adams¦1. First list item`n   - First nested list item`n     - Second nested list item‖https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/writing-on-github/getting-started-with-writing-and-format

*‖mdquoting/‖MSI‖En‖> text¦`single command``¦````nBlock of code`n````¦``````AutoHotkey`n`tFormatted block of code.`n``````‖https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/writing-on-github/getting-started-with-writing-and-format
